title: Intro to HTML
description: Get started with HTML, the language used to create web pages.

steps.title: Step 1: Understanding HTML
steps.description: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It's the standard language for creating web pages. HTML uses a system of tags to structure content on the web page.

steps.title: Step 2: Setting Up
steps.description: To get started with HTML, all you need is a text editor like Notepad (on Windows) or TextEdit (on Mac). Create a new file and save it with a .html extension.

steps.title: Step 3: Creating the Structure
steps.description: Every HTML document starts with a doctype declaration, followed by an html element that contains head and body elements. The head section typically contains metadata and links to external resources, while the body section contains the actual content of the webpage.
steps.codeSnippet:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>My First Web Page</title>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Your content goes here -->
</body>
</html>

steps.title: Step 4: Adding Content
steps.description: Inside the body element, you can add various types of content such as text, images, links, and more using HTML tags.
steps.codeSnippet:
Hello, World!

This is my first web page.
